data.note: Eskom has had well-publicised financial difficulties and has been making fervent attempts to raise the rates it can charge end users for electricity, attempts which the regulator Nersa has mostly tapered down. However, there was previously little need to worry about Eskom meeting it's financial obligations since, as a state-owned entity, it enjoys all debt being backed by the South African government. With the South African economy struggling and sovereign debt possibly facing downgrades to junk status, there is more pressure than ever on Eskom to prove that it can take care of itself.
data.name: Power offtake risk for independent generators
